item.title: Upcoming Magic: The Gathering Crossover Set is Basically Confirmed
item.description:
Based on the recent financial results for Hasbro in the third quarter of 2025, Magic: The Gathering has been a massive contributor to the brand's growth, especially with sales from the Edge of Eternities set. While this is great news for in-multiverse sets, considering the concern about Universes Beyond taking over, Magic: The Gathering has had a lot of success with crossovers, too. Not all players are happy about this direction, and it's something that may show over the next few years, but the train for MTG collabs is on track to deliver yet another crossover with one of the most viral IPs of this year.

With Magic: The Gathering 's Avatar set capping the year in November, and with 2026 being already filled to the brim with releases, it's plausible that this new crossover will come in a different form - a Secret Lair drop and/or a Commander deck. This is because Netflix and Hasbro recently shared their collaboration for KPop Demon Hunters toys and other products, with the first being Monopoly Deal: KPop Demon Hunters . No explicit mention of MTG was made, but considering Wizards of the Coast and Hasbro's approach, this is basically guaranteed for a few reasons:

  • Hasbro and Mattel are both toy licensees for KPop Demon Hunters , with Mattel overseeing production of action figures, dolls, and more, whereas Hasbro will deliver "immersive new ways to engage through play."
  • Hasbro's news release specifically states that the company will be "leveraging the strength of its iconic portfolio—including HASBRO GAMES, WIZARDS OF THE COAST, NERF, and FURBY—introducing a range of engaging collaborations designed to delight fans of all ages," which could mean MTG or DnD products due to Wizards of the Coast being mentioned.
  • Magic: The Gathering 's Furby crossover, as well as that of Play-Doh, reinforces the idea that Hasbro will use its IPs or licenses to make new cards, so KPop Demon Hunters fits the bill for a Secret Lair drop.
  • KPop Demon Hunters ' HUNTR/X and other characters could be perfect for a Secret Lair drop dedicated to each of them, to the main trio as a whole, the antagonists, or even a Commander deck comprehensive of all these options.

Considering all this, it seems only a logical progression for Hasbro and Wizards of the Coast to make MTG products themed after KPop Demon Hunters.

Predicting Every Magic: The Gathering x KPop Demon Hunters Card

There are various characters from KPop Demon Hunters who could get dedicated Magic: The Gathering cards in a possible Secret Lair drop. These are:

  • HUNTR/X
    • Rumi
    • Zoey
    • Mira

  • Saja Boys
    • Jinu
    • Abby Saja
    • Mystery Saja
    • Romance Saja
    • Baby Saja

  • Support Characters
    • Bobby
    • Celine
    • Derpy
    • Sussie
    • The original trio of hunters
    • The 1920s trio
    • The 1940s trio
    • The 1970s trio
    • The Sunlight Sisters

  • Antagonists
    • Gwi-Ma
    • Village Demons
    • Various demons, like Crying Water Demon/Jelly

Other MTG cards could be dedicated to the Honmoon, the various original songs in KPop Demon Hunters, and even events from the movie.

MTG x KPop Demon Hunters is a Matter of When Rather Than If

The reason an MTG Secret Lair drop feels perfect for this type of collaboration is that it allows Hasbro and Wizards of the Coast to work on it more pressingly, as opposed to a full-fledged set or multiple Commander products. The movie is also not so vast in terms of lore and characters to justify bigger crossovers, like, for example, the upcoming Avatar set in November.

With the idea that a KPop Demon Hunters collab with MTG is inevitable after Hasbro's recent announcement, it's worth mentioning that this is likely to happen sooner rather than later in order to match the viral phenomenon that was Netflix's movie. Nothing has been officially announced just yet, but with the collaboration between Netflix and Hasbro just being made public, it seems reasonable to expect possible news in early 2026. MTG 's PlayStation Secret Lair Superdrop is almost here, so fans will have to wait.

65
5.0 /10

item.title: Borderlands 4's Best Crit Knife Alternative isn't a Grenade at All
item.description:
After dominating the Borderlands 4 meta since launch, the game's best build for Vex is no more after the recent nerf to the infamous crit knife, the Vivisecting Throwing Knife. This Borderlands 4 Vex build essentially allowed players to stack the bleed damage from her Bloodletter skill onto critical hits, meaning a weapon like this knife can melt enemies with an increased crit chance that also bleeds them dry. In the wake of this reworked damage interaction, many players are jumping ship and looking for alternative gear for their ordinance slot.

New to Borderlands 4 are other ordinance options beyond simple grenades. Aside from knives as a new throwable, players can also equip Borderlands 4 's Heavy Weapons in their ordinance slot as an alternative to a throwable. With the crit knife Vex build now dead and buried, the Siren still has some impressive ordinance options to take Vex builds to the next level, but they require deviating from the throwable gameplay of the crit knife build.

After the Crit Knife Nerf, Borderlands 4 Players Should Check Out These Heavy Weapon Ordinances

There are a handful of powerful Legendary Heavy Weapon ordinances in Borderlands 4 that can make solid alternatives to the crit knife with the right build surrounding them. Vex players may need to tweak their skill tree investments at the Respect Machine located in Borderlands 4 's major faction towns, but the payoff is more than worth the cost. Choosing a Heavy Weapon to build around is the next step, but luckily, there are three options that synergize very well with potential Vex builds.

Disc Jockey Legendary Heavy Weapon with Corrosive Damage

  • Drops from Sidney Pointylegs
  • Bouncing Biscuits – Energy disc Projectiles bounce up to 5 times, and gain +20% Damage per bounce. Scales up to +100 damage on final bounce.

The Disc Jockey is a great Heavy Weapon for clearing out large packs of mobs, such as those found in Borderlands 4 's Ripper Drill Sites. With its projectile damage scaling by 20% per bounce as the energy discs ricochet around the arena, players can quickly clear enemy hordes as the damage scales up to +100 for the final bounce. In particular, players will want a version of the Disc Jockey with Corrosive Damage, since this elemental damage type synergizes with Vex's Necrosis and Blight Attunement skills.

Sprezzatura Legendary Heavy Weapon with Incendiary Damage

  • World Drop
  • Gungnir – Launches a Laser-Guided Rocket that homes in on the live laser location. On impact or after 5s, it explodes and deals 100% Elemental Splash Ordnance Gun Damage across a wide radius.

Similar to the Javelin from the Call of Duty franchise, the Sprezzatura launches a rocket straight into the air before it crashes down, hitting enemies in the targeted location. What makes this Heavy Weapon so powerful is the elemental splash damage it deals on impact. To this end, Borderlands 4 Vex players will want to find one with Incendiary Damage to synergize with her Burning Attunement and Burnt Offering skills.

Since this Legendary is a world drop, players will want to check vending machines and even spend Golden Keys from SHiFT codes to farm for it.

Ravenfire Legendary Heavy Weapon with Radiation Damage

  • Drops from Inceptus
  • 621 – Explosions radiate outward from the point of impact.

Ravenfire is a Heavy Weapon that excels in both mobbing and bossing in Borderlands 4 , with its Legendary ability to launch explosions in an outward radius around the initial impact. Hitting a Borderlands 4 boss with the Ravenfire's projectile can quickly melt its health bar when paired with Radiation Damage to turn this ordinance weapon into a miniature nuke. Vex's Radiant Attunement and Havoc skills buff this elemental damage type to the point where enemy shields are no longer a concern, and the combination of Radiation's crowd-damaging capabilities and Ravenfire's additional AoE explosions makes this a deadly combination for dealing with an onslaught of Rippers or Order forces.

item.title: Dungeons & Dragons Reveals 8 New Subclasses in Next Book
item.description:
Dungeons and Dragons has officially revealed eight new subclasses that will be coming to the 2024 edition of the game with its upcoming expansion, Forgotten Realms: Heroes of Faerun . The rollout of the newest revision to the massively popular tabletop role-playing game last year saw plenty of significant changes, ranging from classes and species to mechanics and more. The 2024 revision brought four subclasses for each of Dungeons and Dragons ' core twelve classes, both revising popular subclasses like Berserker Barbarian and adding new options like Soulknife Rogue. Now, the next new book will bring even more subclasses.

Dungeons and Dragons ' subclasses serve as one of the main ways for players to individualize their characters' builds, offering multiple different paths to take. Players taking classes like Fighter and Rogue can choose to add magic into their repertoire by taking magic-focused subclasses like the Eldritch Knight and Arcane Trickster. Magic-oriented classes often use subclasses to differentiate their playstyle, with different subclasses typically offering access to their own unique lineup of exclusive spells. A new report is now detailing eight upcoming subclasses for Dungeons and Dragons ' next expansion.

An official announcement from Wizards of the Coast lists eight new subclasses being added to D&D 's 2024 revision with Forgotten Realms: Heroes of Faerun . The list of classes features multiple fan-favorite subclasses returning from Fifth Edition, including Clerics gaining access to the Knowledge Domain and Bladesinger Wizard allowing casters to mix melee with magic. Several entirely new subclasses will also be added with the expansion, including the Winter Walker Ranger focused around harnessing the power of ice and Scion of the Three Rogues providing buffs based on specific evil gods. Forgotten Realms: Heroes of Faerun will release on November 11.

Dungeons and Dragons Adding Eight New Subclasses

  • Bard : College of the Moon
  • Cleric : Knowledge Domain
  • Fighter : Banneret
  • Paladin : Oath of the Noble Genies
  • Ranger : Winter Walker
  • Rogue : Scion of the Three
  • Sorcerer : Spellfire Sorcery
  • Wizard : Bladesinger

The addition of a slew of new subclasses in Forgotten Realms: Heroes of Faerun will provide some unique new playstyles for players to craft their characters. The previously-mentioned Bladesinger not only gives Wizards access to melee weapons, but also provides enhanced movement and powerful features like Extra Attack. The teased Spellfire Sorcerer also looks to be a particularly powerful option among the new subclasses, teasing the Absorb Spells feature as an additional perk to reactionary spells like Counterspell.

Dungeons and Dragons ' newest expansion comes as the tabletop game has looked to bring plenty of new content for fans throughout recent months. Wizards of the Coast debuted a brand-new "Starter Set" for 2024 Dungeons and Dragons last month, providing players with a pre-built adventure, maps, and a curated selection of classes. Dungeons and Dragons also revealed a new Magic: the Gathering -focused supplement to release next month, providing a new adventure in the popular plane of Lorwyn. Wizards of the Coast looks to be committed to giving players plenty of enticing options to dive into the beloved game's newest revision.

Source: D&D Beyond

item.title: Genshin Impact Leak Teases Mondstadt Expansion
item.description:
A recent leak from Genshin Impact is once again hinting at the addition of a brand-new expansion for Mondstadt, teasing the long-rumored addition of Dornman Port. While new regions typically take the focus of the HoYoverse RPG's patch cycles, the developer has often brought players back to previous regions with new areas to explore. Liyue, in particular, has seen the brunt of Genshin Impact 's post-release expansions, adding both The Chasm and Chenyu Vale to the game. Now, Genshin Impact 's original region may finally be receiving another expansion soon enough.

While Mondstadt serves as Genshin Impact 's oldest playable region, the Anemo region has not seen many major expansions since its debut in Version 1.0. Mondstadt's only major playable expansion came with the release of Version 1.2, adding the frigid peaks of Dragonspine at the southern end of the region. While other locations within Mondstadt, like the Dandelion Sea and Dornman Port, have seen rumors and in-game references, HoYoverse has yet to release another sizable expansion to Mondstadt. However, new leaks are suggesting that fans may finally get to see a Mondstadt expansion soon.

Genshin Impact Leak Teases Dornman Port Expansion

A recent update shared by prominent HoYoverse leaker Seele Leaks is giving even more hints about the eventual addition of Dornman Port. The leak shares several pieces of dialogue, seemingly from recurring event character Liben, talking about Dornman Port and providing more details about the seaside town. Liben hints at Dornman Port as being a "port town built on cargo shipping and flower cultivation," teasing it as a laid-back and peaceful town on Mondstadt's northern side. The post does not give a definitive window for when the Mondstadt update will be added to Genshin Impact .

The debut of Dornman Port coincides with a heavier focus on Mondstadt and some of its associated characters throughout Nod-Krai's story. HoYoverse listed Mondstadt's Knights of Favonius as one of the major factions involved in Nod-Krai, officially seeing the long-awaited first in-game appearance of Grand Master Varka. The Hexenzirkel is also said to be heavily intertwined with the region's story, even teasing new buffs for several Hexenzirkel-aligned Mondstadt characters like Klee, Venti, and Fischl. Jean's in-game "Birthday Mail" for 2025 even referenced Dornman Port, with her mother reportedly sent to the port town.

Genshin Impact 's upcoming updates look to be giving fans lots to be excited about for the future of the HoYoverse RPG. The recently-released Luna 2 update brought back several past characters for the new Archon Quest, with characters like Albedo, Arlecchino, and Dainsleif returning for the new story. The patch also brought with it the introduction of Genshin Impact 's user-generated content game mode, officially welcoming the debut of Miliastra Wonderland. A new expansion to Mondstadt could look to breathe some fresh air into Genshin Impact 's original playable region.

item.title: Helldivers 2 Celebrates 'Liberty Day' With A Limited-Time Minigame
item.description:
The annual Liberty Day celebrations in Helldivers 2 are now underway, and players have just a few hours to enjoy a round of 'Whack-a-Terminid' as part of the festivities. Helldivers 2 players can also claim the exclusive Liberty Day's Cape after collectively killing 40 million enemies with the R-2124 Constitution ceremonial rifle by October 27.

Held annually on October 26, Liberty Day in Helldivers 2 marks the day when Super Earth and the Federation host a bombastic and overtly patriotic commemoration of Managed Democracy. Liberty Day has been observed since 2016, when the original Helldivers game celebrated its first anniversary. The October 26 date is also significant in the real world, as it marks the birthday of Arrowhead Game Studios' Chief Creative Officer, Johan Pilestedt, who has been with the company since its founding in 2008. Helldivers 2 first celebrated Liberty Day shortly after its 2024 launch, as players could earn rewards like the DP-00 Tactical armor set.

Helldivers 2 Players Can Whack Some Terminids For Liberty Day

For this year's Liberty Day festivities, Helldivers 2 players have just a few more hours to take a swing at an exclusive minigame. Arrowhead launched Whack-a-Terminid as a desktop browser game that will only be available during the 2025 Liberty Day festivities. Helldivers 2 players can use their mouse to click on Terminid enemies that will periodically appear out of eight potential holes. The game ends once players run out of time, and the timer can decrease if players take too long to hit a Terminid or if they hit any Helldivers that can pop out of the holes. Helldivers 2 players who connect their Discord accounts with the Whack-A-Terminid site can then save their high scores on a leaderboard for bragging rights. Additionally, Helldivers 2 players can claim a Liberty's Day Cape after collectively killing 40 million enemies with the R-2124 Constitution rifle while the event is active.

The 2025 edition of Liberty Day comes at a controversial time for Helldivers 2 , as the PC version has seen some performance issues that have resulted in the Steam version dropping to a Mixed rating. Although optimizations for the PC version are planned, Arrowhead CEO Shams Jorjani said the process of fixing Helldivers 2 would take several months. Some optimizations went live on October 23 with Helldivers 2 's Patch 4.1.0 content update.

Though Helldivers 2 has adjusted its release calendar to focus on optimizations and bug fixes, the annual Liberty Day event came right on schedule. Only time will tell how many Helldivers 2 players will get on the Whack-A-Terminid leaderboard.
